intro: Arabis pterosperma, commonly known as the winged rockcress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces distinctive winged fruits called siliques. Arabis pterosperma is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it adapts well to harsh climatic conditions.
